tournament.name: Rivals League - October Zendikar Rising Weekend

decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans while also putting pressure with evasive creatures. The deck utilizes counterspells like Essence Scatter and Mystical Dispute to keep the opponent's threats in check, as well as removal spells like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch to deal with any problematic cards. The deck also has a mill sub-theme with cards like Into the Story and Thieves' Guild Enforcer. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage from cards like Shark Typhoon and Zareth San, while also having a decently low curve for aggression.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage and fueling graveyard synergies. By efficiently removing threats and countering spells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard and provides a recurring threat. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Cling to Dust and Into the Story to maintain card advantage and fuel the game plan.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and mill effects. By utilizing cards like Essence Scatter, Negate, and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief provide additional pressure through mill strategies, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recurring key cards. With a mix of disruption and win conditions, this deck seeks to outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing powerful creatures with aggressive abilities. It aims to quickly establish a board presence with cards like Brushfire Elemental, Kazandu Mammoth, and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also includes removal and interaction spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Primal Might to deal with opposing threats. The Great Henge provides card draw and additional power boost to creatures. Embercleave serves as a finisher to deliver lethal damage. The deck includes land cards like Fabled Passage and Evolving Wilds for mana fixing and consistency.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. It aims to control the battlefield with efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Brushfire Elemental, while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Embercleave and The Great Henge to close out games. With a mix of high-impact creatures and versatile removal spells, this Gruul Aggro deck aims to win the game through aggressive and efficient combat.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Bloodchief's Thirst to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to attack early and often, using cards like Robber of the Rich to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-heavy strategy, supported by powerful cards like Questing Beast, The Great Henge, and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. By maximizing the use of aggro creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Kazandu Mammoth, backed up by removal and card advantage tools like Skyclave Apparition and Edgewall Innkeeper, this deck aims to quickly establish board presence and outpace the opponent before they can fully set up their own strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive board presence using creatures like Gilded Goose, Llanowar Visionary, and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also utilizes cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Trail of Crumbs for card advantage and protection. With the addition of cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, the deck aims to control the board while continually applying pressure. Overall, the deck focuses on creating a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and control.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Gilded Goose, Llanowar Visionary, and Skyclave Apparition. Emphasis is placed on generating value through cards like Trail of Crumbs and Yorion, Sky Nomad, allowing for continuous pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Wicked Wolf and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats while maintaining momentum. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent colors and curve out smoothly for an aggressive gameplan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption while also maximizing card advantage through mill effects. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by removing threats, countering key spells, and depleting their resources with mill effects. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a recurring threat and source of card advantage, providing additional value throughout the game. Overall, the deck looks to grind out victories through a combination of control elements and incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cycling as both a method of card draw and a way to trigger powerful abilities, such as Zenith Flare. By cycling through cards while playing aggressively with cards like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats and burn spells. The companion creature, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, provides additional value by allowing you to replay cycling creatures or other low-cost permanents from your graveyard.

The deck focuses on using disruptive and controlling elements to support an aggressive strategy. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans with counterspells like Essence Scatter and Didn't Say Please, removal spells like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch, while also presenting threats like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief to apply pressure. Zareth San, the Trickster and Gadwick, the Wizened provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also has some versatility with Shark Typhoon and Agadeem's Awakening for late-game power and recursion. The mana base is designed to support a smooth curve and consistent color requirements.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to slow down the opponent's strategy, while also generating card advantage and value through cards like Mazemind Tome, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Yorion, Sky Nomad. It aims to maintain board presence with removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Ruinous Ultimatum, while also applying pressure with powerful threats like Skyclave Apparition. The deck also includes versatile cards like Omen of the Sun and Elspeth's Nightmare to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck's goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on aggression and putting pressure on the opponent quickly. It includes powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Bonecrusher Giant, along with efficient removal like Scorching Dragonfire and Primal Might. The aim is to establish a strong board presence early on and use cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to finish off the opponent swiftly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize disruption spells like Heartless Act, Mystical Dispute, and Drown in the Loch to control the board while filling the opponent's graveyard with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer. This allows for powerful graveyard recursion with Call of the Death-Dweller and Lurrus of the Dream-Den, while also drawing cards with Into the Story and utilizing the flash ability of Sea Gate Restoration. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind them down with a combination of control and card advantage.

The deck focuses on using a combination of mill and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win condition while steadily depleting their library. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Into the Story, the deck aims to mill the opponent's deck quickly to win through deck exhaustion. Meanwhile, control cards like Mystical Dispute, Heartless Act, and Drown in the Loch help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plays. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent by controlling the game and winning through mill.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting and removing key threats from the opponent while utilizing mill and graveyard interaction as win conditions. This deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal spells, while also utilizing rogue synergies and the power of the Dimir color combination. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an additional layer of resilience and value to the deck, allowing for constant recursion of key threats or disruption spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard recursion, while also utilizing mill as an alternative win condition. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to cast low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game by taking advantage of the opponent's graveyard interactions and utilizing a blend of creature and spell removal, along with occasional card draw and countering spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, card advantage, and the ability to recur threats. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Trail of Crumbs and Elspeth Conquers Death, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Doom Foretold and Acquisitions Expert. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value through blinking creatures and permanents. Overall, the key concept is to outlast the opponent and grind out a win through incremental advantage.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using a mix of counterspells (Negate, Essence Scatter), removal spells (Shatter the Sky, Ondu Inversion, Elspeth's Nightmare), and card draw/tutor effects (Mazemind Tome, Omen of the Sea) to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional card advantage and to flicker creatures like Skyclave Apparition, Charming Prince, and Solemn Simulacrum. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and eventually win through a powerful finisher like Dream Trawler or the land-creature double-faced cards (Emeria's Call).

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively pressure the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells from the Rakdos colors (black and red). It aims to control the board with removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Bonecrusher Giant, while also utilizing cards like Robber of the Rich and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to continuously apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has some graveyard synergies with cards like Ox of Agonas and Tymaret Calls the Dead to further enhance its capabilities.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using a combination of removal spells and card draw. By efficiently removing threats and generating card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game with powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The inclusion of cards like Mazemind Tome and Solemn Simulacrum helps to maintain card advantage and ensure that the deck can stabilize in the mid to late game. Additionally, using cards like Ox of Agonas for graveyard recursion and Irencrag Feat for explosive plays adds versatility to the control strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra to cast powerful spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Genesis Ultimatum. It controls the board with removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Bonecrusher Giant, while also threatening the opponent with large creatures like Terror of the Peaks. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful late-game threats and efficient mana ramp, making it difficult for the opponent to establish their own board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to use control elements to slow down the opponent's gameplay and disrupt their strategy. It focuses on utilizing cards like Mystical Dispute and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to counter or remove threats on the opponent's side of the board. The deck also incorporates a ramp strategy with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra to quickly generate mana and play powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum. The deck includes a mix of creatures like Terror of the Peaks, Bonecrusher Giant, and Beanstalk Giant to provide additional threats or removal options.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while utilizing mill as a win condition. By using a variety of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, the deck aims to control the board and grind out incremental advantages. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for added value by recurring low-cost permanents. The deck also utilizes the synergy between mill effects and creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab to deplete the opponent's library and win the game through decking.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans, removing their threats, and gaining card advantage through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and mill effects. It aims to slowly grind down the opponent's resources while maintaining a superior board state and hand advantage. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value and recursion for its low-cost permanents. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and overwhelming them with card advantage and resource denial.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by milling their deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, while also removing threats with cards like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by drawing extra cards with Into the Story and leveraging the graveyard with Call of the Death-Dweller. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional recursion for key cards, while also serving as a win condition if the game goes long.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plans and gaining advantage through card advantage and removal. It utilizes counterspells like Essence Scatter and Negate to counter threats, while also having disruptive spells like Anticognition and Didn't Say Please to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Removal spells like Heartless Act and Bloodchief's Thirst handle the opponent's creatures, while card draw spells like Into the Story and Cling to Dust provide card advantage. The deck also includes win conditions with the help of Soaring Thought-Thief, Ruin Crab, and Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategies and slow down the game. By using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain a strong board presence. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional versatility and resilience to the deck's game plan. With a mix of reactive and proactive cards, the deck is well-equipped to handle a variety of threats and secure victory through attrition and resource management.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. It utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide extra value by blinking permanents for additional triggers. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Shatter the Sky, while also generating card advantage through Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. It utilizes a combination of counterspells and removal to control the opponent's threats, eventually winning the game through powerful finishers like Dream Trawler and Emeria's Call.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to maintain board presence. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea, while also controlling the board with Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth Conquers Death. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a way to blink creatures and generate additional value, while Dream Trawler serves as a finisher. With a mix of control elements and card advantage, this deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out victories.
